ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, Mar 21/00, Jeff Illian <jeff@...> wrote:
>
> No argument here. Bards are great when the primary class isn't present. We
> seem to have a fantastic ability to fill in the holes of any party and at
> least partially make up for any missing class.

I think here lies the ultimate problem with the bard at high levels.
Verant has made things so difficult at high levels that you have to have
multiple groups for almost everything, and it's not very likely that you
will be missing the primary class at all. This then makes the bard role
extremely limited, taking a lot of the fun out of playing the character.
